page.title: 01CLANERY & CULCRONCHIE AREA
page.content: This area is situated North East of Creetown near to Newton Stewart. This area is mostly rough grazing for sheep and cattle consisting of moorland and Heath. The land has been cultivated in places with this being an expensive business, recultivating is slow. The crop rape which has recently been introduced to this area for its rich vegetable oil content, has been grown with turnip for feeding, helping to force in the fattening process of cattle and sheep for beef and mutton. There is also a small Dam in the area near the Clanery which is used for private fishing giving pleasure to many a fisherman. Brown & Rainbow trout are stocked up in the Dam from time to time.
